alert.note: Alert for Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued May 25 at 4:28AM ChST until May 25 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CHST FRIDAY FOR SOUTH FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING FOR SOUTH FACING REEFS... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, significant coastal flooding. For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 12 to 16 feet in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Tinian and Saipan islands. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, until 6 PM ChST this evening. For the High Surf Warning, until 10 AM ChST Friday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure will be inundated. Some shoreline erosion will occur. Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.
